input:
Bernard , who had not told the government official that he was less than 21 when he filed for a homestead claim, did not consider that he had done anything dishonest. Still, anyone who knew that he was 19 years old could take his claim away from him . 

In other words, anyone . True or false?

Meanwhile, in the forest, the elephants are calling and hunting high and low for Arthur and Celeste , and their mothers are very worried. Fortunately, in flying over the town, an old marabou bird has seen them and come back quickly to tell the news. 

In other words, their mothers mothers are very worried. Fortunately, in flying over the town, an old marabou bird has seen them and come back quickly to tell the news. True or false?

I tried to paint a picture of an orchard, with lemons in the lemon trees , but they came out looking more like light bulbs. 

In other words, lemon trees came out looking more like light bulbs. True or false?

Larry , a timid teen-ager, lives with his widowed mother in a Brooklyn housing project. Larry Larry's father , a gang leader, was shot to death; his father's disciple, Antonio , takes Larry under his wing, and quickly molds him into a drug runner. 

In other words, Larry's father wing, and quickly molds him into a drug runner. True or false?

Then Dad figured out how much the man owed the store; to that he added the man 's board-bill at the cook-shanty. He subtracted that amount from the man 's wages, and made out his check 

In other words, the man subtracted that amount from the man 's wages, and made out his check True or false?

Jane gave Joan candy because she was hungry. 

In other words, Joan was hungry. True or false?

Always before, Larry had helped Dad with his work. But he could not help him now, for Dad said that his boss at the railroad company would not want anyone but him to work in the office. 

In other words, Dad now, for Dad said that his boss at the railroad company would not want anyone but Dad to work in the office. True or false?

The large ball crashed right through the table because it was made of styrofoam. 

In other words, The large ball was made of styrofoam. True or false?

Everyone really loved the oatmeal cookies ; only a few people liked the chocolate chip cookies . Next time, we should make more of them . 

In other words, the oatmeal cookies . True or false?

Mr. Moncrieff visited Chester 's luxurious New York apartment, thinking that it belonged to his son Edward . The result was that Mr. Moncrieff has decided to cancel Edward 's allowance on the ground that he no longer requires his financial support. 

In other words, Edward no longer requires his financial support. True or false?

Every day after dinner Mr. Schmidt took a long nap. Mark would let him sleep for an hour, then wake him up, scold him, and get him to work. He needed to get him to finish his work, because his work was beautiful 

In other words, Mr. Schmidt needed to get him to finish his work, because his work was beautiful True or false?

The large ball crashed right through the table because it was made of styrofoam. 

In other words, the table was made of styrofoam. True or false?

Joe Joe's uncle can still beat him at tennis, even though he is 30 years younger. 

In other words, Joe's uncle is 30 years younger. True or false?

Mr. Moncrieff visited Chester 's luxurious New York apartment, thinking that it belonged to his son Edward . The result was that Mr. Moncrieff has decided to cancel Edward 's allowance on the ground that he no longer requires his financial support. 

In other words, Mr. Moncrieff financial support. True or false?

The path to the lake was blocked, so we couldn't reach it . 

In other words, the lake . True or false?

Joe Joe's uncle can still beat him at tennis, even though he is 30 years younger. 

In other words, Joe is 30 years younger. True or false?

Alice was dusting the living room and trying to find the button that Mama had hidden. No time today to look at old pictures in her favorite photo album . Today she had to hunt for a button , so she put the album on a chair without even opening it . 

In other words, album . True or false?

In other words, Larry could not Larrylp him now, for Dad said that his boss at tLarry railroad company would not want anyone but him to work in tLarry office. True or false?

Fred watched TV while George went out to buy groceries. After an hour he got back. 

In other words, George got back. True or false?

The storekeepers stayed in town to run their stores and lived in the rooms behind them . 

In other words, stores . True or false?

In other words, Larry wing, and quickly molds him into a drug runner. True or false?

The customer walked into the bank and stabbed one of the tellers. He was immediately taken to the hospital. 

In other words, The customer was immediately taken to the hospital. True or false?

Papa looked down at the children 's faces , so puzzled and sad now. It was bad enough that they had to be denied so many things because he couldn't afford them. 

In other words, faces had to be denied so many things because he couldn't afford them. True or false?

Meanwhile, in the forest, the elephants are calling and hunting high and low for Arthur and Celeste , and their mothers are very worried. Fortunately, in flying over the town, an old marabou bird has seen them and come back quickly to tell the news. 

In other words, the elephants mothers are very worried. Fortunately, in flying over the town, an old marabou bird has seen them and come back quickly to tell the news. True or false?

The stable was very roomy, with four good stalls; a large swinging window opened into the yard , which made it pleasant and airy. 

In other words, stable pleasant and airy. True or false?

Jane gave Joan candy because she wasn't hungry. 

In other words, Jane wasn't hungry. True or false?

The path to the lake was blocked, so we couldn't use it . 

In other words, The path . True or false?

Fred watched TV while George went out to buy groceries. After an hour he got up. 

In other words, Fred got up. True or false?

One day Dick was teasing the colts, and did not know that the master was in the next field; but he was there, watching what was going on; over the hedge he jumped in a snap, and catching Dick by the arm, he hit him so hard that he roared with the pain and surprise. 

In other words, the master jumped in a snap, and catching Dick by tthe master arm, the master hit him so hard that the master roared with tthe master pain and surprise. True or false?

Since Chester was dependent on Uncle Vernon , he couldn't very well marry without his approval 

In other words, Uncle Vernon approval True or false?
